com.angryelectron.fona

Class Fona

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.angryelectron.fona.Fona
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FonaEventHandler

    public class Fona
extends java.lang.Object
implements FonaEventHandler
    Primary class for controlling a Fona / SIM800 cellular module via serial port.

    Based on the Sim800 AT Command Manual, this class only implements a subset of the features supported by the SIM800. Feel free to implement any missing features by contributing to the GitHub Project.

    Notes

    • All network-based operations use a hard coded Bearer Profile Identifier of 1.
    • Some settings, required for correct operation of this API, will be written to NVRAM. See open(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer) for a details.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String port,
                 java.lang.Integer baud)
          throws FonaException
        Open serial port connection to SIM800 module. This method will alter the configuration of the SIM8000 with settings necessary for the proper operation of the API, writing the values to NVRAM:
        • Auto-baud is disabled (AT+IPR=baud)
        • Local echo is disabled (ATE0).
        • Network registration unsolicited result code is enabled (AT+CGREG=1)
        • All other settings restored to factory-defaults (AT&F)

        Note: Disabling auto-baud is required to receive notification when the serial port is ready for use. If the application re-enables auto-baud, simWaitForReady(int, com.angryelectron.fona.Fona.Ready) will always timeout when used with Fona.Ready.SERIAL or Fona.Ready.BOTH, but Fona.Ready.NETWORK will work and provide reasonable assurance that the serial module is also ready.

        Parameters:
        port - Port name (/dev/ttyUSB1, COM7, etc.)
        baud - Baud rate. 115200 is recommended.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if port cannot be opened

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String port,
                 java.lang.Integer baud,
                 FonaEventHandler handler)
          throws FonaException
        Open serial port connection to SIM800 module and set handler for asynchronous events.
        Parameters:
        port - Port name (/dev/ttyUSB1, COM7, etc.)
        baud - Baud rate. 115200 is recommended.
        handler - FonaEventHandler for handling incoming SMS and Calls.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if port cannot be opened

        Throws:
        FonaException - if communication with serial port fails.

      • emailPOP3Login

        public void emailPOP3Login(java.lang.String server,
                           java.lang.Integer port,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String password)
                    throws FonaException

        Parameters:
        server - POP server host name or IP.
        port - POP port. Typically 110.
        user - POP username.
        password - POP password.

        FonaException - if configuration fails

      • emailSMTPSend

        public void emailSMTPSend(FonaEmailMessage email)
                   throws FonaException
        Send e-mail. Note that if the FonaEmailMessage has more than one FROM address, only the first one will be used. Ensure SMTP is configured using emailSMTPLogin(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer) or emailSMTPLogin(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
        Parameters:
        email - FonaEmailMessage object.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if email cannot be send

      • gprsEnable

        public void gprsEnable(java.lang.String apn,
                       java.lang.String user,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws FonaException
        Enable GPRS. GPRS must be enabled before using any of the other GPRS methods. Most mobile carriers publish their APN credentials. On boot, GPRS is 'enabled' but not 'authenticated'. This call will block up to 15 seconds while waiting for the network to register.
        Parameters:
        apn - Cell provider APN address.
        user - APN user.
        password - APN password.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if GPRS cannot be enabled.

      • gprsEnable

        public void gprsEnable(java.lang.String apn,
                       java.lang.String user,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.Integer timeout)
                throws FonaException
        Enable GPRS with user-defined timeout.
        Parameters:
        apn - Cell provider APN address.
        user - APN user name.
        password - APN password.
        timeout - Max time to wait, in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if GPRS cannot be enabled

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • simPowerOff

        public void simPowerOff()
                 throws FonaException
        Power-down the SIM800 module. This may have different implications depending on how the hardware has been configured. For example, a FONA with KEY tied to GND will reboot after this command, although the time required to reboot varies. In testing, sometimes this command returns "NORMAL POWER DOWN" and other times returns nothing, so the result is ignored. In general, it is probably best to use hardware-specific methods (like FONA's KEY line) to control the power state of the device.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if fona is not responding.

      • simSleepMode

        public void simSleepMode(boolean enable)
                  throws FonaException
        Sleep Mode. When enabled, the SIM module enters sleep mode when DTR is high, and wakes when DTR is low. When asleep, the serial port is inaccessible until 50ms after wake-up.

        Note: FONA modules don't use the DTR pin, so if sleep is enabled the only way to wake-up is to reset/power-cycle.

        Parameters:
        enable - Use low-power sleep mode when true.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if fona is not responding

      • onSerialReady

        public void onSerialReady()
        Internal. Used by methods that reboot or reset the module to wait until the module is ready for use. When called, this method will fire the application's FonaEventHandler, if registered.
        Specified by:
        onSerialReady in interface FonaEventHandler

      • simFunctionality

        public void simFunctionality(Fona.Mode mode)
                      throws FonaException
        Set functionality mode. Default mode is FULL. In cases where the mode is changing to/from MIN and FLIGHT modes, this method will switch to FULL mode as an intermediate step, as changing between these modes directly is not allowed.

        If reset is enabled, the application must wait until the serial port is ready before sending AT commands, and until the network is registered before sending any GPRS commands. This can be done using:

        • simWaitForReady(int, com.angryelectron.fona.Fona.Ready)
        • FonaEventHandler.onSerialReady()
        • FonaEventHandler.onNetworkStatusChange(com.angryelectron.fona.Fona.Network)

        Here is a typical "wakup" sequence:

         
 simFunctionality(Mode.FULL, false); // wake-up
 simWaitForReady(15000, Ready.NETWORK); // wait for network
 gprsEnable(APN, USER, PWD); //login with credentials
        Parameters:
        mode - new Functionality Mode: MIN, FULL, or FLIGHT.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if mode cannot be set

      • simReset

        public void simReset()
              throws FonaException
        Reset / reboot the SIM800 module. Reboots into FULL mode. Be sure to wait for serial and/or network to become ready after reboot. See simWaitForReady(int, com.angryelectron.fona.Fona.Ready).
        Throws:
        FonaException - if fona is not responding

      • simWaitForReady

        public void simWaitForReady(int timeout,
                            Fona.Ready ready)
                     throws FonaException
        Wait until SIM800 module is ready. Blocks until ready. For asynchronous notification, use FonaEventHandler.onNetworkStatusChange(com.angryelectron.fona.Fona.Network) and FonaEventHandler.onSerialReady(). See open(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer) for an important note about auto-baud and the implications on this method.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Max time in milliseconds to wait for module to become ready. In tests it took as long as 15 seconds for the network to register following a reboot.
        ready - Ready signal to wait for: Serial, Network, or Both.
        Throws:
        FonaException - on timeout.

      • simReadADC

        public java.lang.Integer simReadADC()
                             throws FonaException
        Read Analog/Digital Converter.
        Returns:
        Value between 0 and 2800.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if ADC read fails.

      • simUnlock

        public void simUnlock(java.lang.String password)
               throws FonaException
        Unlock SIM card.
        Parameters:
        password - SIM card password.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if error is related to ME functionality.

      • simRSSI

        public java.lang.Integer simRSSI()
                          throws FonaException
        Received signal strength indicator.
        Returns:
        RSSI in dBm between -54dBm and -115dBm. -999dBM indicates that the signal strength is not known or is undetectable.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if RSSI cannot be read

      • simProvider

        public java.lang.String simProvider()
                             throws FonaException
        Name of Service Provider. Value is read from the SIM.
        Returns:
        Name of Service Provider.
        Throws:
        FonaException - if no SIM / name cannot be read.

      • temperature

        Returns:
